availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Trimble Handlin (Livingston County, Kentucky, attorney and judge.)

body.p: Livingston County, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Livingston County, Kentucky, native. Son of Joseph Handlin and Catherine C. Trimble Handlin. Married to Rosa B. Clark Handlin in Marshall County, Kentucky, on February 16, 1859. Father of William R. Handlin, Clara Handlin, and Margaret Handlin. Attended school in Crittenden County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Livingston County, Kentucky, in 1860. Presiding judge of the Livingston Circuit Court in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 1, p. 213B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Livingston County,
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Livingston County, Smithland, p. 249B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994048, Marshall County Marriages.
Eugene Earl Trimble, Trimble Families: A Partial Listing of the Descendants of Some Colonial Families (Kensington, MD: 1958), 154-5, 170-1.
"I T Handlin (1832-1882)," Find A Grave, Memorial 74612574, accessed March 3, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/74612574.
KYR-0001-025-0012.
